docs.snippet: Black African nations today challenged the credentials of the South African delegation to the United Nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Black African nations today challenged the credentials of the South African delegation to the United Nations.
docs.abstract: Zaire Pres Mobutu Sese Seko on Oct 4 announces in speech to UN General Assembly that his nation is breaking diplomatic relations with Israel; Zaire is 8th African country to break relations with Israel in last 20 mos

headline.main: SOUTH AFRICANS CHALLENGED IN U.N.; Black Nations Lead Effort to Reject Credentials

byline.original: By JAMES F. CLARITYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: From a cluster of aging white buildings on Quarry Heights here, the United States Southern Command maintains military influence in 16 Latin-American countries and directs the defense of the Panama Canal.
docs.lead_paragraph: From a cluster of aging white buildings on Quarry Heights here, the United States Southern Command maintains military influence in 16 Latin-American countries and directs the defense of the Panama Canal.
docs.abstract: Article on reductions in US Southern Command's arms force in Panama Canal Zone, where it directs defense of canal, as part of gen reduction in US mil strength throughout Latin Amer; notes manpower reduction to present level of about 10,000 men and reductions in numbers of combat surface-to-air missiles, aircraft and other arms; notes uncertainty about negotiations with Panama on treaty of '03, which Panama want to replace with one giving it control of canal zone

headline.main: U. S. CUTS ROLES OF PANAMA FORCE; See Diplomatic Role Missions Are Restricted Shopping Elsewhere Defense of Canal and Aid to Latin Nations Diminished

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO-"What this country needs," said the Minister of the Interior, Gen Oscar Bonilla Bradanovic, in a recent exposition of the Chilean junta's views, "is political silence."
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO-"What this country needs," said the Minister of the Interior, Gen Oscar Bonilla Bradanovic, in a recent exposition of the Chilean junta's views, "is political silence."
docs.abstract: continuing raids by Chile's mil authorities in search of leftists and weapons and 'executions' that frequently accompany them revd; statement by Interior Min O Bonilla Bradanovic that mil will return to barracks when it has 'discovered all hidden arms and guerrilla schools, and when we have changed the mentality of the people' noted; church efforts on behalf of foreign exiles in Chile and imprisoned Chileans noted; purge of leftists in most Chilean institutions and spread of mil control throughout country noted; reliance on rightist Natl party at expense of more progressive Christian Democratic party in econ matters discussed; appeals for foreign, particularly US, investment and likely effect of recent devaluation of escudo noted; illus of soldiers and prisoner

headline.main: A Silence Broken Only By Rifle Shots; Chile After Allende The World

docs.snippet: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.-Brazil, Bolivia, Uruguay-and now Chile. Latin America is becoming a heap of ruined ideas and victims' bones. At the top a tribunal of uniformed pygmies legislates, excommunicates, and executes nonbelievers. In the meantime, Mr.
docs.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.-Brazil, Bolivia, Uruguay-and now Chile. Latin America is becoming a heap of ruined ideas and victims' bones. At the top a tribunal of uniformed pygmies legislates, excommunicates, and executes nonbelievers. In the meantime, Mr.
docs.abstract: O Paz calls for alternative to rhetoric of condemnation that has been Left's response to mil takeover in Chile and internatl conspiracy that made it possible; says Latin-Amer Left needs viable programs and new strategies and tactics in order to overcome forces against them; says that, as basis for such a program, it must realize that despite Allende's defeat, democracy not only can exist with socialism but is essential to true socialism; says that Left must also give up idea that socialism, in its original Marxist conception, is possible in insufficiently industrialized country dependent on export of single product; says Left must work to develop programs that are democratic, that contain seeds of future socialism and, most importantly, that suggest models of econ development and social organization of a less inhuman and unjust kind than those of capitalist regimes and of 'bureaucratic socialism'

headline.main: Article 4 -- No Title; By Octavio Paz

docs.snippet: An Uruguyan national, described as the top supplier of cocaine in the United States, was arraigned yesterday in Federal Court in Manhattan and held in $500.000 bail.
docs.lead_paragraph: An Uruguyan national, described as the top supplier of cocaine in the United States, was arraigned yesterday in Federal Court in Manhattan and held in $500.000 bail.
docs.abstract: A S Tobais, Uruguayan natl described as top supplier of cocaine in US and who was recently expelled from Chile, is arraigned in Fed Ct, NYC, on Oct 22 on $500,000 bail

docs.snippet: Heavier than expected cuts in Arab oil production already have reduced output more than 4 million barrels a day, or by about 20 per cent, the authoritative Middle East Economic Survey said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: Heavier than expected cuts in Arab oil production already have reduced output more than 4 million barrels a day, or by about 20 per cent, the authoritative Middle East Economic Survey said today.
docs.abstract: Bomb wrecks shop in Armagh, Northern Ireland, village of Newtonhamilton on Oct 27; 4 firemen and 1 soldier are injured; bomb was planted during night by 3 men who are believed to be members of IRA; police sources say Army experts tried to defuse device but decided that it was dangerous to make further attempts and ordered fire-precaution methods to be taken; firemen were hosing down neighboring bldg when explosion flung broken masonry and glass into their midst

headline.main: World News Briefs; Bomb Hurts Five In Ulster Village Uruguay Gets Interim Aide A Military Center Blasted in Portugal Congo to Release Political Foes Arab Oil Output Cut Back 20%

docs.snippet: Two Argentine ships, one--a navy transport, collided early today in a narrow channel of the Rio de la Plata estuary off the coast of Argentina. Twenty-four persons were missing and believed 'drowned.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two Argentine ships, one--a navy transport, collided early today in a narrow channel of the Rio de la Plata estuary off the coast of Argentina. Twenty-four persons were missing and believed 'drowned.
docs.abstract: Rio V (Freighter) and Ushuala (Argentine Transport): Argentine freighter Rio V and Argentine Navy transport vessel Ushuala collide on Oct 28 in Rio de la Plata estuary, 90 mi from Buenos Aires; 24 persons, all crew members or civilians from Navy ship, are missing and feared drowned; Navy dispatches 3 helicopters, 2 planes, 2 launches and 2 tugboats to scene; Rio V rescues 53 of 80 people from Ushuala despite gaping hole in bow and continues on to Buenos Aires; cause of accident is unknown; map of area

headline.main: 24 From Argentine Navy Ship Missing in Collision

docs.snippet: The chief White House international economics adviser said that Congress should temporarily shelve legislation on trade concessions to the Soviet Union while Middle East negotiations were under way.
docs.lead_paragraph: The chief White House international economics adviser said that Congress should temporarily shelve legislation on trade concessions to the Soviet Union while Middle East negotiations were under way.
docs.abstract: NY Times incorrectly reptd on Oct 25 that NYC Police Dept raised maximum age limit for recruits from 29 to 35 yrs; change has been proposed by dept but not yet approved by NYC Council

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International Metropolitan The Other News Quotation of the Day CORRECTION National

docs.snippet: The Uruguayan Government closed the nation's only university last night and announced the arrest of at least 150 people, including the rector and the deans of nine of the 10 departments.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Uruguayan Government closed the nation's only university last night and announced the arrest of at least 150 people, including the rector and the deans of nine of the 10 departments.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt on Oct 28 closes nation's only university and announces arrest of at least 150 people, including rector A Perez Perez and deans of 9 of 10 depts; charges that university, which was last stronghold of opposition to dictatorial measures taken by Pres J M Bordaberry in June of '73, was center for Marxist indoctrination and incitement to armed struggle; blames university council for Oct 27 explosion in engineering dept which killed the student who is alleged to have been preparing a bomb at time of blast; says searches of university, which followed explosion, have turned up subversive literature and explosives; charges university authorities failed to maintain order; places university under Cultural Min E Narancio and declines to say how long it will be closed

headline.main: URUGUAY ORDERS UNIVERSITY SHUT; 150 Are Arrested, including Rector and 9 Deans Blamed in Student's Death Investigation Under Way

docs.snippet: A group of eight nations tonight proposed a formula that could open the way for troops from Panama, Nepal and perhaps an African country to join the contingents already on duty with the United Nations peace-keeping force in the Middle East.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of eight nations tonight proposed a formula that could open the way for troops from Panama, Nepal and perhaps an African country to join the contingents already on duty with the United Nations peace-keeping force in the Middle East.
docs.abstract: 8 nations on Nov 1 propose formula that will open way for troops from Panama, Nepal and perhaps African country to join contingents from Sweden, Austria, Finland and Ireland, already on duty with UN peace-keeping force in Egypt, UN Security Council; suggest that Poland and Canada initially supply logistics for force; suggestion is attempt to avoid US-USSR deadlock over whether to include Warsaw Pact member on force; formula suggests Panama, Peru, Uruguay, Indonesia, Yugoslavia, Nepal, Ghana and Liberia as possible suppliers of contingents; Security Council Pres P Jankowitsch says that 'further progress' has been made and that more informal meeting will be held on Nov 2; US repr J A Scali says that important divergencies remain; refuses to comment on whether US will try to block inclusion of Poland by using its veto; Soviet repr N N Loginov says his attitude toward new formula is 'positive' but USSR is expected to seek some changes; during private meetings on Oct 31 USSR insisted on acceptance in force of troops from Poland, Bulgaria, Hungary and Czechoslovakia, which are members of Warsaw Pact, and objected to role of Canada, which is member of NATO; India on Nov 1 proposes that Canada's logistics role be balanced by giving Poland same role; Canadian Sec M W Sharp is flying to UN for talks with UN Sec Gen Waldheim concerning Canada's role; Soviet repr Y A Malik and reprs of Yugoslavia, India, Guinea, Sudan and Kenya object that Israel should not exercise 'veto' over contingents from nations that have broken relations with it

headline.main: 8 in U.N. Offer Formula On Filling Mideast Force

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times
